intro: Nolana stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nolana, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its hairy leaves and deep root system, which help it conserve water. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nolana stenophylla is often found in coastal and desert habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
